sites.title: UC Berkeley Campus
sites.summary: Flagship campus of the University of California system, founded in 1868.
sites.description_md:
# University of California, Berkeley

Founded in 1868, UC Berkeley is the flagship campus of the University of California system. The campus is renowned for its academic excellence, research contributions, and role in the Free Speech Movement of the 1960s.

## Campus Architecture

The campus features a mix of architectural styles, from the classical Beaux-Arts buildings like Wheeler Hall to modernist structures like Wurster Hall.

sites.title: Berkeley Rose Garden
sites.summary: Terraced amphitheater rose garden offering panoramic views of San Francisco Bay.
sites.description_md:
# Berkeley Rose Garden

Created in 1933 as a Works Progress Administration project, the Berkeley Rose Garden features over 1,500 rose bushes arranged in a natural amphitheater setting. The garden offers spectacular views of the San Francisco Bay and Golden Gate Bridge.

sites.title: Berkeley Marina
sites.summary: Waterfront recreation area built on landfill, featuring a marina and extensive parkland.
sites.description_md:
# Berkeley Marina

Developed in the 1960s on landfill, Berkeley Marina extends into San Francisco Bay and provides recreational opportunities including sailing, windsurfing, and kite flying. The area includes Cesar Chavez Park, built on a former landfill.

sites.title: Telegraph Avenue
sites.summary: Historic street near UC Berkeley, center of 1960s counterculture and student activism.
sites.description_md:
# Telegraph Avenue

Telegraph Avenue, particularly the section near UC Berkeley, became famous during the 1960s as a center of counterculture and student activism. The street remains a vibrant area with bookstores, cafes, and street vendors.

sites.title: Berkeley Hills
sites.summary: Hillside residential area offering panoramic views and surviving the 1991 Oakland firestorm.
sites.description_md:
# Berkeley Hills

The Berkeley Hills area developed as an exclusive residential district in the early 1900s, featuring winding roads and spectacular views. The area was severely impacted by the 1991 Oakland firestorm but has since been rebuilt with fire-resistant landscaping.

sites.title: First Church of Christ, Scientist
sites.summary: Historic Christian Science church designed by Bernard Maybeck in Arts and Crafts style.
sites.description_md:
# First Church of Christ, Scientist

Designed by renowned architect Bernard Maybeck and completed in 1910, this Christian Science church is considered one of the finest examples of Arts and Crafts architecture in the Bay Area. The building features innovative use of materials and natural lighting.

sites.title: Berkeley City Club
sites.summary: Historic women's club designed by Julia Morgan, featuring Gothic Revival architecture.
sites.description_md:
# Berkeley City Club

Designed by Julia Morgan and completed in 1930, the Berkeley City Club was originally built as a women's club. The building showcases Morgan's mastery of Gothic Revival architecture and now operates as a hotel while maintaining its historic character.

sites.title: Peoples Park
sites.summary: Small park created by activists in 1969, site of significant protests and ongoing community activism.
sites.description_md:
# People's Park

Created in 1969 when activists and residents converted an empty lot into a community park, People's Park became a symbol of the conflict between authority and grassroots activism. The park remains a site of ongoing community engagement and political expression.

sites.title: Lawrence Hall of Science
sites.summary: Public science center named after Ernest Lawrence, featuring interactive exhibits and planetarium.
sites.description_md:
# Lawrence Hall of Science

Opened in 1968 and named after Nobel laureate Ernest Lawrence, the Lawrence Hall of Science serves as UC Berkeley's public science center. The facility features hands-on exhibits, a planetarium, and educational programs for all ages.

sites.title: Claremont Hotel
sites.summary: Historic luxury hotel straddling the Berkeley-Oakland border, known for its distinctive white facade.
sites.description_md:
# Claremont Club & Spa

Built in 1915, the Claremont Hotel is a landmark luxury resort that straddles the border between Berkeley and Oakland. The hotel's distinctive white Victorian architecture and hilltop location have made it an iconic Bay Area destination for over a century.
